YfVr5FHU03gDzUzK1smghA.text: I dont frequently go to eat here, not that there's anything wrong with it, but it's not an elite restaurant. I would usually go here and get the 'endless' bowls, but on my last trip, they got rid of it and moved to small, medium, and large sized bowls. The pricing for what you get is also higher than it used to be. Before the switch to the sized bowls, I'd give it four stars. After all this, I would still recommend this place

xchDMrNW4LgxUujXwMZVkA.text: My wife loves this place!! I am not as big of a fan, but I always try to make my own and it's is always just Ok. She follows one of the recipes and taste good. She when we go out to eat she always wants to go here.

x2rkAY-bk6a_RCR-tbJIzA.text: The buffet style stir fry is an awesome restaurant idea! There isn't another like it around.  I wish they added shrimp as a protein choice but overall I love to frequent this place and it's especially addictive since I love close by!  Hundreds of ways to put together the perfect meal!

pVR7vIclq_7km4lXwSV4rA.text: On one hand, it's tough to complain when you make your own stir fry bowl. Genghis Grill offers several meat, vegetable, sauce, seasoning, and starch options, thus completely putting you in the driver's seat. The cooking, however, is subpar. Not bad, not great, but for hungry customers, it suffices.

d1CUGdE5gf9X27V7iAyUPQ.text: This review is simply from a customer service point of view. They have certain drinks that come in custom Genghis glasses for customers to bring home. As I was leaving with my glass I was rudely approached by a employee that asked for my glass. I handed to him assuming I was in the wrong and I explained the menu said I could take the glass. He said it costs money and my waitress should have told me that. I leave and begin to realize I could have paid for that glass and he should have asked. Also why was he so rude? I called the restaurant shortly after I left and was told they would let their employees know. No apology or explanation. Simply rude.

OBBEw6N8MGJWePzyR_pYPw.text: When it first opened, the price was reasonable and the portion size was appropriate for the price.  Just went in today and they've changed portion sizes.  What is a $9.00 bowl is the size is something a 4 year old could eat.  I'm not a huge portion eater so I thought I'd try it until I was told there is an upcharge to add shrimp.  RIPOFF.  Place wasn't crowded like it used to be.  Guess they have to raise prices to keep the lights on.  I'm not interested in returning.

sOkCAoPXk_vo0Keg4UihYA.text: Stopped in yesterday for dinner. Terrible food. Very bland and not cooked enough.

8lEI4pnzHh4VEt1ErsJhiA.text: This is one of those places where your dish will be as good, or as bad as you make it.  That said, my food was outstanding.  I'll definitely go here again the next time I visit Charlotte.

OAZNQy6Eyur_gT_nGt9AQg.text: It's a make-you-own-bowl type of thing and they cook it for you hibachi style. There's so many choices of meat, veggies, seasonings and sauces to choose from!  And on your birthday you get a 'to die for' Brownie with Ice Cream. Everytime I go there, service has always been great, and I go a lot. I would highly recommend.

tmGprVb2g3ouiIjgUPezaQ.text: Okay but the noodles were over cooked and some of the vegetables were frozen,  not fresh as we would have preferred.  It's worth trying but it wasn't the caliber we were hoping for.  We've gone to a few different build your own wok houses in different areas, and this one was just so-so in comparison.

665gy3v4zNIpYh8x1ZJR6A.text: Super,super friendly staff!! It was cool being able to choose raw meats, seasonings, veggies and sauces to be cooked. My 11 year old was excited about picking her own foods as well. I'm on a no carb diet so I had lots of options. Food was cooked perfectly. Flavored well. We will definitely return real soon!!

sgiugA2eu3dSVDegmAfgig.text: Had lunch here and we loved it!!! Service was excellent!!! We where immediately greeted and shown to a table. Our waiter came right over and explained/walked us over to the service area. Very, very nice young man his name was Dannon. Meats,veggies,condiments and sauces where great!!! Dessert and drinks great!!!! Price was reasonable for great service, and a full belly!!!

PLkrhxqwQpDienwT1zC7Tg.text: The restaurant seemed nice at first appearance.  Appetizer -chicken potstickers were great.  The bowl size  wasn't too big. It was $9.99 a bowl  (dinner)and make bottom less bowl  ( repeat bowls) was another 4 dollars.  Not  a lot once cooked.  Could have cooked a little longer as broccoli was still completely hard and not even warm.   And the initial bowl is small.  For family of 4, it was expensive  for amount of food.  I was very excited for the restaurant to open up,  but overall  disappointed.  Felt like we rush thru the  entire process and  rushing us out the door.  Won't go again

_JwCtD2ztH4J30IjXZ0xEA.text: Always clean and fresh ingredients. A nice change from the routine. Fun for the family concocting your own meals.

YDv04m00ZeJgcF4GVsA5sA.text: I love this place and the concept... Yes, you should know what flavors work best for you and how to marry them.. But most people do.. It's just a fun concept with choices of exactly what you like!  I highly recommend this place!

gUvHELJLqHboUZmaod3icw.text: Good food ! We enjoyed making our bowls "our way"! Good service. $6.99 bowls coming up all day on 9-18-13!

UOmkCZ_x813Mo8fcZO9tzA.text: OMG this place was alsome. Jamie was great. Me and girlfriend went her first time at a place like this and she loved it Thanks

v96odsk8LWa15EQoUY8UsA.text: Tried this place out for the first time and it was fantastic!  Thanks to my family for the tip.  The meal tasted great and it was relatively healthy and the price was right!

NU84VkWATsOPDDabFg6PQw.text: love this place!  it's healthy and one of the best values I've had in quite some time.

pzot-oYi_wcdQGctHC0Vyg.text: Love this place. Think of it as DIY stir fry. Tons of veggies, spices and sauces to choir from to go along with your protein and starch of choice. They also have suggestions for combinations if you don't want to venture out and create your own. It's a laid back atmosphere. Nothing fancy. Just delicious food.

XXtI2ji1rGz17_ZtKEom8g.text: Always enjoy the food and the service is great here.  If you leave here hungry than something is wrong.  Monday is double points day! Who doesn't like a deal?

6j2tA_1RGslIAZGsKYs4WA.text: We hadn't been in awhile due to it being a little trek for us to get there. But the last time it was good enough to get us to make the almost hour drive again.  The food score is mid ninety's, the hostess was very nice, seated us, and took our drink order quickly. The server came, holding a small stack of stainless bowls, greeted us and asked if we'd been in before. We said yes but it had been awhile; she said we just got a new menu and made some other changes; like the name card so when your bowl is cooked they can find you. I would have been fine with a standup number card to let them know where we were seated, but wait, what happened to standing there and waiting for the grill cook to hand it to you? Another change. Our very nice server then explained about the bowls. At first we thought the bowl was for only the meats/seafood section, but we were told no, it is for  that and all the veggies too. Oh no, I don't take much of the meats, but I love the veg and I feared the new bowl wouldn' be able to access all I chose, it didn't. The sauces were a little confusing to me and with short arms I had to reach to to get a few items. So, after you put what you can in the bowl a cook is waiting to take it from you and get your starch order because these items are no longer on the bar with the other food. Another change. I asked for steamed rice and it came mixed in with my stir fry ...it always came on the side...did not know you had to ask for it not to be mixed in, another change.  It seemed to be overpriced for what you get. We miss the original order of things and probably won' t make the long drive anytime soon.

zvuIwd_ln-LGgVkqV-uyKA.text: An exceptional dining experience. Uniquely different with building your own bowl however the staff made it very easy. The variety was great and the cleanliness was good as well. I will be going back

tWxid5uPzFjRWa5w3bJmNw.text: We've visited other Ghengis Grills before and have always had good experiences. We were in the Matthews area and decided to give this one a try. Although the place wasnt very busy, we were greeted with slow service, the server never smiled or said "thank you" or "you're welcome," the floors were sticky, the bathroom was a mess, and there were missing ingredients on the buffet line.  Needless to say, we won't be returning to this location.

kPHrYttvtpxB8mjgEdjelw.text: Top.   Excellent service, food, varity and value!   Loved it!   Kid friendly yet w full bar.

_x07myiY_rFwayFnyiYthA.text: HORRIBLE SERVICE!! The food here is always okay. It's usually pretty tasty, if you can get seated. I've been here a few times and it never fails - the service sucks. This time we didn't even stay. There was a bartender at the bar (at the front door) and several members of the wait staff had passed us by as we waited to be seated, and no one even spoke to us. After about 10 minutes we went next door to Casa Rita's and had an amazing experience. Unfortunately this was not the first time we've had a very sub par experience with GG's, so this will be the last time we ever give them a chance. Don't waste your time on rude wait staff and don't waste your money on okay food.

DRpOnIyzAQlEd3rWhc5iTw.text: I had no concept of what Genghis Grill was but when they opened in Matthews, I decided to check it out.  It was the first week and I guess everyone else was curious too.  The place is loud - like the cafeteria in a night club loud.  Lots of hard surfaces, tall ceilings, loud tv or music - just noisy.    We didn't have to wait long for a table and was seated in the back.  The kitchen is open and there was a line what I assumed was a salad bar.  It wasn't.  The concept of this place is that you take your bowl, stand in line, and then fill it with as much raw stuff as you want.  Then you hand it over, someone else cooks it, and brings it to you.    For people who know what they want, you might like this...but why.  The concept of a restaurant is to have someone give you a menu of items, you choose what you want, and they prepare it for you.  This place requires a bit of imagination...imagination I don't have.  As a result, my meal was terrible.  No one to blame but myself since I chose the ingredients but if I want to screw up my dinner, I can eat at home.    I took my son hoping there would be something for him as well.  They have the requisite kids items (pizza etc) but he wanted to be like me so he grabbed his bowl and stood in line with me.  Raw meat looks gross - it just does - so he was unimpressed.  He ended up with some imitation crab and an egg in a bowl.  They scrambled his egg and give it back.    Nearly $40 for 3 people to eat and I have to make my own food and if I make it lousy, it's my own fault.  Yeah...no.

ieK3xISKn-pEE9tfdckHlA.text: So many options!  I love building my own stir fry, buffet is kept very clean and all the sauce options are amazing.

Y5uqvpF5jjioLrfOVYhs-A.text: Slow, dirty, brings the wrong order to the table twice.  Seriously people all you have to do is cook the food and refill drinks.  Your customer does the rest and it would be better if they cooked and served themselves.

JfTYLBqZ3ynZRsEA2FpqOg.text: I went for lunch today.  Place wasn't very busy.  Sat at the bar.  Waited for 10 minutes for a server.  Finally somebody came and refilled the water glass of a guy a few seats away.  Then he got into a long conversation with the hostess.  After another 5 minutes I left.  I don't think they cared.  Not going back.  From the lack of people at noon, I think others have come to the same conclusion.

EHqFHjMmpYXHEFs1_Qphpg.text: Great concept but the food is sub-par. I got the steak and rice, really plain because that is how I like it but I did not get asked how I wanted my steak cooked so I kinda just went with it. When I got home, I took a bite of the steak and it was just almost raw, gross. I literally had to recook my steak. Idk, just not my cup of tea for a hibachi spot. First and last time.

UMSrfDMXcnbHret0KFSHEg.text: Much like the previous reviewer, we didn't just feel rushed through dinner.  We actually were rushed.  We did not get appetizers as they likely would have arrived after dinner.  I couldn't help but think of Gordon Ramsey's Kitchen Nightmares as regards the menu and food gathering, "It shouldn't be this bloody complicated or require so much explanation." Don't listen to the staff regarding spices.  We did and the food turned out bland.  They are very protective of the seafood and try various ways of limiting it.  The food was okay but not worth a return trip.  I have never gotten a check so fast ever.  The facility is way too small and too cramped and the layout was done very poorly.  The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable but you could tell they are pressured to turn tables quickly.

cusrJjquig17FefV-GmZWg.text: This place is poorly designed and poorly managed. First, there is only a single -buffet line, which gets very congested and moves slowly when the place is even half full. It took us nearly 30 MINUTES just to get through the line! The buffet didn't appear to be super-clean, with customers having spilled various selections onto others. When we went through, it appeared that the steak option had been long depleted, without any of the staff caring to replinish it - or worse yet, they may have run out?!? On a busy Saturday evening, no less??  Our experience only got worse from there. We were looking to take out our meal, so after making our selections, we sat at the bar, thinking it would be a quick turn. After almost ANOTHER 35 MINUTES, we noticed the server and manager in a discussion after she told us she was getting our bowl. I caught the tail end, where he nonchalantly said, "just apologize". She came by and said that she had given our bowl to another customer!!   We've eaten at this chain in several cities. This experience has led us to NEVER go to this establishment again!! A BASIC tenet of chain restaurants is that the customer gets a consistent experience, wherever they may eat. As they are clearly unable to deliver on that promise, they have lost our business forever.  We discourage you from going to this restaurant!

OedxyqrxXuJSKjj6OATzOg.text: Very good food! Staff super friendly and helpful. You go in and are seated at a table, handed and menu, waiter comes by asks for drink order, then asks if you know how the system works, if not they explain it all to you. Our waiter was nice, but we didn't see much of her.  It's a topping bar style, do-it-yourself, make your own stir fry place, however if your not in the mood to really think about putting a bowl together, you can pick from a menu. First you choose your meats (raw) and they have everything from chicken, to seafood, to beef, to turkey. Next choose your spices. Add veggies, and there is plenty of great variety and they are fresh, pick out a sauce (fyi Dragon sauce is awesome), then take it to the 'grill area' and pick out a starch. (The tofu was very good too!)  **TIP: Pile your bowl high, the veggies and meats reduce when they are cooked.   The food was very healthy, tasteful, full of flavor, and cooked very nicely. You can watch your food being cooked as well. Prices were a little high, however I would return because the food is quality. For a lunch bowl it was $7.99 and for dinner is was $9.99.    Side note, it was a VERY cold inside, might wanna bring a light jacket.

esYL6b7O8xvrcL4g--0N-Q.text: We were just at your location on Independence Blvd. and complained to the manager about cleanliness. The last several times we ate there we had to request the waitress to clean the table and the floor is always sticky. Tonight was the last straw because when the bill came the folio was greasy inside. There was no way for the waitress not to notice but she gave it to me anyway. Then, when we complained to the manager he did not seem to care. We left and will never return.

dgFM9LRRPyJEyaSG5FaPxQ.text: i. love. ghengis. i went here on a date, the following week i went back myself. It was that good. My first visit was at the ballantyne location. I tried this one because i was in the area and too far from ballantyne. i was still pleased. i love the cafeteria style build your own plate thing. Its a new trend in restaurants. There are others like Mod pizza, etc with similar preparation structures. The best advice i was given from our server was "be greedy, get as much as you want it will all be cooked and added to your bowl. And make sure you go overboard on veggies because those shrink down". i LOVED HER. i put a heaping amount of veggies on my bowl and they fell all over my tray. i love the combination i created with the dragon sauce, ginger, lemon pepper and a few other things. I am so glad my date led me here. I may not see him again but i'm definitely building a relationship with this place lol!

B856f1WWbi69t5uGJ8vJhw.text: Food was very good but the service was very subpar.  We had a waitress that acted like she did not want to be there at all. We ordered an appetizer and never got it and all we were told was "yep, I forgot to put it in", not an apology or anything like that.  Great concept and great food, but definitely need to get service up to par.

PC__HwVYelC35i8hhWyPgQ.text: I enjoyed my plate of brown rice and a mixture of meats, veggies, spices and sauces on top. I like that they have suggestions for the combinations one can try if you're there for the 1st time and aren't sure what dish to make. Even so, I had a lot of fun creating my own bowl and savored every bite of it.

8Fl4jFKdN9Io42oqSRkyRw.text: This was my first time dining here after wanting give it a try for a while. I've been to this type of restaurant before...you choose your protein, seasoning, vegetables, sauce, and side. The service was great! Our waitress was spot on and told us to fill our bowls nice and high! She encouraged us to get as much as we can. After I went through the line and did what I was told we left our bowl with a cook and he prepared it for us. It was delicious! I definitely will be back. It's a great option and allows you to control what your eating!

Eloi0qpjfUj7GseRBG4TdQ.text: Love this place, my first time there I didn't know what to do, the hostess stepped in and explained everything. The concept is brilliant and there is a variety of whole foods for those of you that #eatclean like me.

ZD5akAyDzPGXbNKo9LdfWg.text: Really wanted to like this place. Ate dinner in Fri 2/3 with my daughter. She had a bowl with chicken and shrimp, I piled every meat they had into my bowl. Food was delicious.  However...got food poisoning which started around 5am Saturday morning. Thought I should go to the hospital during one 2-hour stretch. I'll spare you the details. An elderly person would have had their life at risk. By late evening Saturday night I was through the worst of it and improving.  There is no doubt in my mind this illness came from my meal at this restaurant. My daughter did not get sick.  Unfortunately, I will not be patronizing again. This is the risk you take eating at an establishment that has raw meat laid out in reach of the public for long periods of time. In fact, I'm just going to scratch Mongolian BBQ in general off my list.

F6CbP0Zg-vol0EvmLH4gLw.text: The concept of this restaurant is rather unique if your food doesn't taste good it's kinda up to you because you are in control of everything I think I'm do for a vist there soon

-bveSG7NXQPuhPgSEUMtag.text: This an ok location towards south charlotte in the JC Penney store area on Independence.  The service was friendly and helpful getting you started.  We sat at the bar and they have a tv, with inexpensive wines including sake and a couple of beers on tap as well as bottled beer.  You are given a small bowl that you can heap up with various proteins and veggies of all sorts, some marinated, some not and you can choose a sauce to be cooked with it all.  There is a selections of dried spices and seasonings so you can make it to your taste and hot or not.  There are tasting spoons for you to try the sauces, but because there is a line behind you, you don't really get to taste them all 'cause you don't want to hold everyone up.    You get a choice of starch (noodles/rice etc...) to go with it and you can add an egg to it as well.  They take your bowl to be cooked on the flattop, and give you a number and bring it to the table when it's done.  I really like the taste of mine (beef tips, calamari, scallops w/chestnuts and mushrooms with a honey soy sauce), but I felt they went very light on the starch (udon noodles for me).  I felt like I would run out of noodles before I was half done with the rest of the dish.  I would probably go back, but not if I was really hungry.

BMDhWn1-pCU2i_vZCU3Qnw.text: If you've never been to a Mongolian grill, definitely check this place out!  The service process is really cool.  You fill a bowl of your own toppings, meats, veggies, and such, and it gets stir fried up and mixed with your rice or noodles.  They also have some cool drinks, lemonades and such that you can add a shot of liqour to for just $2, ends up being a sweet deal!  Fun night and good for reasonable prices.

BxJzmOXgAe8wA7ImYPZMqg.text: First time in a GG.  My creation was good.  Ingredients lacked some freshness.  Some of the spices were all clumped together.  Produce freshness questionable for some items.  The herbs were not fresh. My biggest complaint:  $2.70 for an iced tea!  Really?!  The most expensive tea in town--outside of the Ritz Carlton!  What gives?! If I'm going to spend $20 on lunch, I'd like to be full when I leave & the quality of ingredients to be better. I don't spend this much for lunch at more expensive places in Ballantyne or Southpark & have better food quality & satisfaction.

aDslKgLSv_euz-acNbu7Qg.text: Yum yum. Fresh meats and veggies and all kinds of flavorings stir fried on a huge flat iron grill. It's a create your own culinary adventure. Will definitely come back here again. Matt, my server was so friendly and helpful, explaining all of the different options. You can even go low carb and choose cabbage instead of a starch to add into the stir fry.

photos.caption: Photo of Genghis Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. My stir fry. I chose ginger, garlic, Cilantro, mint and a thai peanut sauce. It was so good!
Photo of Genghis Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. The grill with everyone meals cooking.

lbJ0ChFke8VIkbsLyIaDgQ.text: This place never fails. Always helpful staff, good food. I like that is always fresh and healthy.  There must be a high turnover in staff. I don't ever see the same people but they are always good.  I do a different mix each time I go in. My husband is very picky and he loves to come to this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Genghis Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. Love this place!!
Photo of Genghis Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. TV&#39;s
Photo of Genghis Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. Bring it!

6R2wdJU5F4LhyrKkxxy8iQ.text: Pretty good but the service is awful. I'm deathly allergic to oranges so I asked for none in my bowl. When I take a bite it's like an orange explosion and my throat immediately started to swell up song close. They need to pay more attention because this could have killed me. When I went back, she asked if I was going to buy another one. Wtf!? She was so rude like she didn't believe me or something. I would appreciate if a manger would get in contact with me because that's not ok when it comes to people's lives

Nh1Fm-Q3hMmXqncK-CAmzw.text: This is a very unique concept! I would recommend a small bowl! With a medium I still took a take-home box

photos.caption: Photo of Genghis Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. Two build your own medium bowls

wDmbF9h9GObaA7PXJDAVCw.text: Usually a fan of Ghengis but this particular location is awful. When I got my food it was cold and it had just come off of the grill! The staff was not very helpful and it was hard to get their attention on a slow night. If you're going to let people handle their own raw meat the least you can do is cook it

iSBMcmfs1dBXXKeT-o4oJg.text: Eaten here a few times and I really like the concept. You chose a bowl size (sm, med, lg) and fill it yourself with whatever protein, toppings, starch and sauces you want and then it's all grilled together on a flat top stove. They do have a menu with already put together ingredients if you're really lazy or just don't feel like filling you're own bowl. Food ends up tasting pretty good regardless of what combinations you put together. They have tables if you don't want takeout as well as a full bar with seating and tvs.

photos.caption: Photo of Genghis Grill - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Genghis Grill - Matthews, NC, United States

B-CfibQWe4wcEtfEGXXs0Q.text: Way overpriced, not clearly marked!  Very disappointed.  Will not be returning.  Food was ok, but not worth the price!

QhoV09iUaf3V-8DFMcDzuw.text: Awsome restaurant. Awsome service. I am vegetarian and I like to eat veggies with pasta and all spices and sauces they offer. I will give a tip..i like it that way if someone want to try it.  So what I do is..fill up bowl with all vegetables of my choice. I put green onion always and jalapeno too. Now always take sauces and spices in a separate small container and mix it up with a tester spoon . Now when i give to grill person..i tell them to cook very well done and all sauce put at the very end just to mix and pour in plate. As sauces and spices not cooked too much it tests awsome. Try it..

ddKVeofMcWKMdlpuHr3Waw.text: Not as friendly as the Ballantyne location and space is much smaller. Selection of food was great the food was cooked perfect. We did have a challenge with service as we came with a large party and the sever became flustered. It must have been teenager night as everyone working was looking at their phones and standing around talking. Defiantly loved the food and well cooked but service was like I was at a High School concession stand. I love the concept but the location and experience at independence I will not be retuning.  Again food was cooked perfect and the store was very clean but the service turned our celebration sour.

ep16opJ-Bx8GMCxdeQuLXg.text: I have not really written any reviews before but the owner was so nice that I wanted to repay him for his kindness by writing a review.    We just completed a cross country drive from Las Vegas, NV to Charlotte,NC.  We are a family of 6, with sleeping twins when we arrived.  We had not had any sleep as we drove through the night.  When we got there the waitstaff were completely accommodating, the food looked amazingly fresh, the wok was clean, and the owner/manager came to speak with us.  He asked if we would like some cups to get us started in our newly moved into unfinished apt.  ( furniture has not arrived yet).  He sent us home with cups, plates, silverware, a gallon of water, and a huge bag of ice!    Thanks so much!  We are so grateful!  Can't wait to go back!  Everything was delicious!!

rDnDLE1vmyuKQxZStSUg5w.text: A year ago I would have given this place 5 stars. Over the past year, every time we go there for lunch there seems to be a different procedure for getting your food(i.e. Where you get the bowl, new menu every few months, etc). The rewards program has become a joke. The freshness of the vegetables has gone downhill, to the point where I pass on some of them now. Service remains good. I feel like the company is being badly managed on a corporate scale. I just hope it doesn't get to the point of Subway where they sell fake food like "Turkey based Ham", that was the last time I spent money at subway...

Cc9-xkHrnk0DYFgJo4-pZg.text: Love this place. I've yet to sit and eat at the restaurant because I always stop by on my way home from work to pick it up for dinner. It's a great, healthy meal. I just wish there was one in the Uptown area....oh yeah, and the shrimp is coming back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Genghis Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. The &#34;GRILL&#34;

vvdsw_0nwRmwC47fZPV3iA.text: Dirty place:  There was raw meat juices on the serving handles of the meats, good on the floor, and grease on the floor in all areas of the dining room.  Employees were visiting with each other when they could have been cleaning to possibly prevent someone from falling from stepping in grease.  I asked if the noodles were made with buckwheat, since that's what udon noodles are supposed to be made with.  (I asked because some places use a combination of wheat & buckwheat flours to save money.). Our server didn't know, so she went & asked 2 other employees.  One didn't know & the other one had her tell us that they are made with buckwheat flour.  They weren't.  In fact, they were just regular wheat noodles in the shape of udon noodles - no buckwheat at all.   There was no shrimp, but fish in the bin labeled shrimp.

ccxtF5G_tf02lRHgLsEf1Q.text: I can't say enough good things about this place. The food combos are nigh infinite and you get to do everything to your own taste. Great place to eat. And it is way more food than what it looks like.

skihDL5jKj-X-LJF82viMQ.text: Lauren is the best hostess! Informative knowledgable and polite. Give her a promotion!!!! Food was good but her attitude was better than any gg we've been to. Thumbs up!

02KvysQD7eFiWKApabyyOQ.text: We ate here last month for lunch and while the food was delicious there basically was no service. We had to ask for refills and our bowls once our order was cooked and even hunt down a server and ask for our check. We overlooked the service since the food was so good. We decided to go back yesterday for lunch again. We will never go back. We had to wait for shrimp to be defrosted in order to make the bowls we wanted, the raw steak was brown and tasted funny to my son, veggies were empty and not being refilled, I had to ask the cook for sauce cups and once I got my bowl, it took 25 minutes before my husband's and son's were done and they ended up walking to the counter and getting them themselves. Then my husband's bowl was so burnt he had to start all over again just for them to burn the second one! I don't mean overcooked either I mean the meat was black and crispy. Why? Because half the time the cooks at the grill had their backs turned not even watching the food. They did comp his meal only after I asked and didn't want their free dessert. The poor people next to us tried ordering off the menu and they were out of everything. Once they did find something it was brought out completely wrong. Unless management changes we won't be back.

0WJdfvhnLy9SsGtfxxBUng.text: I would recommend a first timer to firstly sign up for the reward program before visiting.  Get a free appetizer or dessert.  Be sure to go heavy handed on any bowl size because the meal will be smaller than you thought once it's cooked.  At least your free item, will make the experience balance out.  I made my order based on a previous patron review.  It turnt out pretty good but I was missing my rice in my dish with noodles.  I got the peanut butter dessert as my freebie for joining the rewards program.  Once my meal was cooked and ready to go, the waitress informed me I would be given the other two dessert choices to complete the free item.  So once I got home, I ate my meal first and realizing my rice wasn't there.  After I ate, I open up three containers to see two desserts in one box, one in another, and there's my rice in the last box.  I felt like my initial meal was worth $6 but with the rice maybe $8.  The lemon raspberry cake and peanut butter cake were moist & delicious.  The Oreo was quite dry.  If I come back next time, I'll get more creative with added topping to such a small bowl.  YouTube gave me some building ideas.

photos.caption: Photo of Genghis Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. Rice in separate container, 2 desserts together, 1 separate
Photo of Genghis Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. First time any DIY Asian buffet - forgot the rice.  $12 meal med bowl

Phk-m4dhIThNid4PbC1FVA.text: I was driving back home and my boyfriend and I saw Genghis Grill (both have been to other locations), we decided to stop in and have lunch. From the moment we walked in, we had the best experience ever. The host opened the door for us and he seated us at a table, and he pulled the chair out for me. It was so sweet. Everyone in that restaurant made sure that we had everything we needed (refilled drinks, sauce, and anything else). This was the best service we have had at a restaurant in so long! And the food was so yummy!! Do yourself a favor and go eat at this place. You won't be disappointed!

40-r54_T1v3vyWZ9nFIsTQ.text: I love Genghis Grill!I go at least once a month as I did yesterday.I enjoy how there is a large assortment of ingredients you can choose from and so many days ways to create your dish to perfection.There are three different size of bowls.I usually get a regular sized bowl and have enough leftovers for a snack.They have a special on the bowl prices Mon through Fri before 4pm I believe (about $1 or so cheaper).  Genghis Grill can get quite crowded sometimes,especially on a Saturday.I remember going one time and there was a wait.However,all the staff members seat and serve guests as fast as they can.There is a female and male manager and I would just like to commend them because every time I go in there they are working so hard and leading by example.Sometimes managers forget they have to get in and get dirty too,but these two definitely don't.Kuddos to you two!!

8ts_AglLc4vW9GJMiuAdfw.text: This place rocks! Being vegan-friendly is a plus. Price for the bowls are reasonable. Just wish there was a location in the University area.

photos.caption: Photo of Genghis Grill - Matthews, NC, United States

vVy42SW09U5oYkXjQ550Xg.text: Genghis Grill is awesome! Great selection of meat and veggies for an awesome price. Will definitely be returning!

WnvMPq9IeOlSaeONuXjHXA.text: Today was the first time I visited this location. I usually go to the location in Ballantyne. But this was one of the worst and most disgusting restaurants I've ever been in. First of all when you walk in it smells awful and the floor is clearly not kept up with there was dirt everywhere. My family and I ordered our drinks and food and just tried to enjoy ourselves. After getting our bowls to fill at the bar I went over to the meat bar first. At first glance everything looked fine. But when I stuck serving tongs in the steak bin the steak was all frozen in a big block. Next, the shrimp had an odd smell and color on it. We did not even get past the meat bar before leaving the restaurant. I will not visit this location again. I told my waiter about the steak and he did not really seem to care. We will not be back.

N9rhxyerUADkKsTNAKCG4Q.text: I wouldn't waste my time writing this unless it was seriously BAD. I know this place is not a five star restaurant so I wasn't expecting much else than fast food stir fry grill...but the place was filthy! The tables were sticky as were the floors. The staff was friendly but not well trained lots of run around and confusion. The grill is on top of the small restaurant so the entire place is hot and smokey. Finally this is the part that made me gag. RAW CHICKEN WAS LEFT OUT in a pool of oily pink chicken water!!! I still feel bad that I didn't take a picture and send to the health department. So I'm writing this review instead. Please don't eat hear TRUST me!!!

vpymFfZKmadarTaER7pvuA.text: The server that we had was fantastic, very attentive and pleasant. The management staff on the other hand was far from it. We asked to take our refill bowl home because it took 40 minutes to get and we did not have time to sit there any longer, the serve informed us that we could not have a box because it was the unlimited box. I explained to her that I understood that this was the policy but that we had waited so long for our food that we could not wait any longer. The server then went to the manager and asked if we could have a box and explained to him the situation and he said no. I then asked to talk to the manager and when Chaz approached the table he was rude from the start. I again explained to him why I was asking for an exception and he stated that I was being "confrontational" and stormed off to get us a box. When he returned to the table I explained to him that I was not intending to come across that way, I was just explaining to him again what the server had just explained. He then accused me of trying to convince the servers to break the rules, rolled his eyes and stormed away from the table. Our server was very apologetic for her managers actions, but this does not make up for the managers actions.

C-CvLjeVZVOqJRWUt0I7sQ.text: We love coming to GG. You make your own bowl...so if it taste bad look in the mirror. They help guide you to what you like and offer tasting spoons for sauces. Be warned the HOT sauces are just that! HOT!! If you have never been to one please ask questions. Servers are there to help and guide.

photos.caption: Photo of Genghis Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. No starches. Just meat and veggies. Stack the bowl high as you can and ask for eggs at the counter to be added in.

34fKincRQ-DYccerARttkA.text: I really enjoyed my dinner. It reminds me of a place in AZ. The only thing I wish was better was the amount of rice or sides that you get, it was really small, but the meat/fish is fresh, not dried like other places.

photos.caption: Photo of Genghis Grill - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Genghis Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. Had a really good dinner from Ghengis Grill the other night. I give it a big thumbs up for the atmosphere, fresh ingredients and no of sauce

9FjB3NPULGow_sBdKaUOeg.text: Had the pleasure of visiting on a Wednesday late afternoon, first visit. The service was excellent, the young man was very clear on instructions on how to make up your bowl, and prices were reasonable.  The food bar was clean and the food prep grill was decent. The food was very good! I'm vegetarian I was very satisfied with the meal. One thing I noticed was the floor in the seating area felt sticky.  Not cool.

photos.caption: Photo of Genghis Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. Took family to the Genghis grill, good food and great service.

iDw7xXRhBtC9d6wreFAKpg.text: This is a very different kind of restaurant.  Basically you pick all of you food to mix in raw and then give it to the cooks to prepare for you.  It is a fun idea.  I like the crab and the noodles.  I always ask for double noodles.  They have some delicious sauces and spices to pick from as well, make sure to taste them first!  And don't forget your egg to bind everything together.    The staff is friendly and helpful.  The restaurant is organized and there is never much of a wait.

13B7DINvNIeFSbGSoG0mAA.text: Friendly staff, I think my waiter was named Curtis, he was great. Good food and the cooks were obviously well trained. The staff wasn't afraid to make jokes and that was comforting. We felt very welcome and the taste was unparalleled.

J_O0v1ObMApOxzHHnlHGSQ.text: I didn't know of they'd opened another in the charlotte area. I was out shopping and decided to give this one a try. Walking in I was slapped I'm the face by heat. It was HOT in here. But I was greeted with a smile and proceeded back to fix my bowl.  This is slightly smaller than the one in Ballantyne. There's only one buffet line which makes more sense since the one in Ballantyne only has one at a time open anyway. I like this buffet line better tho because the grill is right at the end of it!! So there was no risk of lifting my tray and losing anything off top!! This location does not have cheese or sour cream though. And they burned my bowl!! All I tasted was the burned sauced scraped from the grill to my bowl. Will definitely not be returning to this location. Only positive thing was the setup.

photos.caption: Photo of Genghis Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. Burned bowl

LbbiniUiL0dP2Z--YCiciw.text: This place is awesome!  The wife and I caught a late lunch here today and really enjoyed it.  I love the fact you can build your bowl from top to bottom and see what's going in there.  It's all grilled on a circular flattop.  I was skeptical of how the veggies were going to be and wasn't sure how long they had been out, but everything was fresh and delicious.  I had Korean BBQ pork with broccoli, baby corn, snow peas, asparagus, asian chili sauce and something amazing called Mongo BBQ sauce.  I chose the Udon noodles.  My wife had teriyaki chicken, veggies and fried rice.  The service was friendly and fast.  It's right around the corner from where we live and I anticipate we will be regulars.

photos.caption: Photo of Genghis Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. Yum!

eg2J87qwjqUfJNLdCDJk6w.text: Choose your own raw ingredients such as meats, veggies, spices, sauces and starch from a buffet style setting to fill your bowl. They cook it on this large round grill for you and deliver it to your table. Oh my goodness, was it ever delicious!!!    We had a restaurant like this in Stone Mountain GA back in the '70's that we would go to at the corner of Rays Rd and Memorial Drive called Kubla Khans Mongolian BBQ. I had always missed it and wished that I could find another one.  Here it is!!!  The service was fantastic. The staff was happy and singing together.   Try the raspberry basil limeade. It is wonderful. The unique cookie butter filled wontons for dessert are to die for with the chocolate drizzled on them and standing up in vanilla ice cream. Awesome!!!  Holy smokes this place is good.

_lWWSXPZ7-pQXUPClqz1sw.text: This place is awesome!! Staff is great. Place is clean. Selection is spot on!!! This is my new favorite resturant!! Thanks for a great expirence.

asnV_k1piiJvc_iviWZdHg.text: I love this place you can't complain about the food because you choose all of your ingredients, which includes meat, veggies,spices and any sauce.

j2LOIFHIt93XUk0F70di7w.text: Good food would have given 5 stars but service wasn't too good but good food, and if you go enough you get  your bowl jest right.

qVQrnVfMOhQtbh28R-DqAw.text: What a great concept. Think Chipotle but hibachi style. Fill up a bowl with as much meat and veggies as you can. Add in some rice and some sauce and get it all cooked together. On Tuesdays you can get discounted takeout.

F6z6nBVAQWlV5HnCXQbzaw.text: Okay so my husband the cook of the family LOvED this place. The food was good but not knowing spices and flavors I was a little lost. I picked my meats and veggies and had noodles & fried rice. Portion was perfect. I had leftovers. Everything cooked up fine but again not being really good about spices and flavors I wasn't really sure what I was doing. They do have items you can order that are made by kitchen which takes the guess work out of it. Server & staff were very nice. Convenient to have the bar even though we didn't drink this trip. Will definitely go again.

photos.caption: Photo of Genghis Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. Butcher&#39;s block. Selection of meats

Lm1cPRop7-IWP0aux6CAfw.text: Never again. 1. Starter was cold 2. Ordered the signature bowls...you get 1/3 less food..at least  3. Individuals that were seated after us got their food 1st...they did not order signature bowls 4. Food did not come out together...we both ordered signature bowls 5. Missing an item on the signature, not a big deal but why have a signature bowl if you're not able to make correctly 6. NASTY bathrooms, so bad you dont want to even wash your hands,  thank you Purrell and the final reason to never come back... The waiter delivered another persons bowl to one, that rolled his fork in it, told the waiter that was not what he ordered, waiter calculated which table the food should have gone to amd simply turned around and dropped it at that table!  Your call to eat here...

mByX2jlixCz4_8U3h5dbCQ.text: It's been a long time since I've been to this spot due to moving to another area of the city so when I was on this side of town this was my lunch pick. Me and my companion got the medium bowls and decided to eat in. As always great choices and the staff made great recommendations for sauces and heat. I love the idea of putting together my own entree and this place makes that happen. Quick, friendly service and I think the value is good for what you get.

photos.caption: Photo of Genghis Grill - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Genghis Grill - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Genghis Grill - Matthews, NC, United States

J2FP3npoO9dWUrBxPjpwzA.text: Traveled to Matthews often and never had tried it place. It's a cross between chipotle and Asian hibachi. Not much really but it's fast food. I had a few things and you can pile high. The staff is nice. The cook went out of the way to help out and explain what sides you get. It's ok.  Solid 3 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Genghis Grill - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Genghis Grill - Matthews, NC, United States

85Myo4q69nq3TTOroGZMVQ.text: Trying to escape traffic I just happened to stumble across this place. I am so glad I did. This restaurant is similar to one that is back home but they have excellent choices. Got a bowl full of delicately delights and I got the 3G sauce. The 3G sauce is really good. My entire experience was great with this restaurant except the fact that they only gave me like a half of cup of rice to go with my food. I also got the Oreo cookie cake square which was good as well. I have a container full of meat and veggies but no rice.

photos.caption: Photo of Genghis Grill - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Genghis Grill - Matthews, NC, United States

H0WBXULdxNhoAf3ovyP4EQ.text: Awful. I was reluctant to come back here a third or fourth time. The last 2 visits in the past were not pleasant. I chalked it up to a bad night and/or poor management. Perhaps it's all of the above now? The service was the worst. The food was (as usual) overpriced for what you get. It wasn't bad but I've had better stir fry at a Chinese take out. The floors are always sticky and the stations are sloppy. Won't come back to this particular location ever again.  Maybe the other locations are better

Kwbn75UaFXUtIuqXXl2NMw.text: I will start by saying that I ate here with my daughter who has been here quite a few times and loves it. However, this was first visit and I would never go back if it weren't for my daughters positive comments about past experiences. We arrived for lunch shortly after opening and were the first patrons to be seated. A young man came to take our order and we both chose a frozen margarita. A couple of minutes later a woman came to our table to inform us alcohol was not available on Sunday before noon. We both chose a Coke product instead which was quickly served but completely flat. The server did a great job informing me of the options and bowl sizes so we ordered and were on our way to the buffet. Everything was fully stocked and nicely displayed. We approached the grill and were greeted promptly by a nice young man. We ordered our bases and went back to be seated. When our food was delivered I was shocked to see how charred it was! There were bits of chargrill stuck to the side of both of our bowls and unrecognizable burnt pieces that I picked out from the food. We managed to eat most of it without complaining. Our server had brought us drink refills and we were hopeful these would be carbonated but they were just as flat as the first ones. We then relaxed and talked while waiting for the bill. My daughter had placed her debit card on the table as a sign we were ready when the server came by and asked if there was anything else we needed, which we declined. We assumed our bill would appear promptly but it took several more minutes before she came by again to see if there was anything else we needed and we had to ask for it. Then after waiting several minutes again for her to come back I finally said let's go pay it at the bar. As we stood up and began walking up there the server appeared from around the corner and took it for us. It will take some sweet talking to get me to return here.

7EA14HLqgUqbkHo-Ht_jfg.text: We used to love this place but lately it seems the standards have gone downhill. The food took forever and when it arrived it was burnt. Almost all of our food was completely black. The waitress offered to have them quickly recook some of the meat because we didn't want to wait for another bowl. The whole thing had a charred taste and the manager never once came over to apologize or address the issue. He was too busy on his cell phone. We will go to the Ballantyne location going forward.

photos.caption: Photo of Genghis Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. Food was completely burnt! Used to love this place but service is terrible now.

quhhbZPYo_s_QyAkmU5frw.text: Today was my last visit to Ghengis Grill, which saddens me because I always looked forward to going.  The visit started out fine. We went in between lunch and dinner, hoping it would be less crowded since the line to pick your meats and vegetables tends to bog down during peak hours. It was surprisingly busy and we ended up waiting quite awhile for our food to cook. We didnt mind because we've always loved their food and knew it would be worth the wait.  Both of us ordered the bottomless bowl, which we always do. Mine arrived cooked perfectly; my husband's was burnt and he didn't eat it all. When asked if we'd like to make a second bowl, we said yes! The second bowls were both cooked to perfection, and were made much quicker, too. We ate what we could and then this is when everything went south.   I asked for two takeout boxes.   I was immediately informed that bottomless bowls were not able to be taken home. Mind you, there was a good portion left in each of our bowls. I told her that we'd taken home our leftovers at least half dozen times before and she said, "Sorry, it's policy." I asked to speak to the manager.  The manager came out and said the staff has been "retrained" and that they never should've allowed us to take food away all those times in the first place. They would rather throw good food away...how wasteful. All she kept saying was "No exceptions."  As a customer service manager myself, this is no way to treat your customer. Rules are not always black and white.  It's a shame that one horrible ending has tarnished what was once an enjoyable place to eat.

GnDQYSpKgkoya-QusUDYrw.text: We love this  place. You pick everything that goes in your bowl. You can change it every time you go. The food is always fresh. The restaurant is clean and the staff are always friendly. Wish there was one closer to my house.

-R5ARn65MfTdO70yfZwmXA.text: Unfortunately this is the closest Genghis Grill to us and it has repeatedly let us down on food quality and service. This last visit is the final time that we will go to this location. One of our meals was burnt and they offered a 15% discount. Less than 5% was eaten. They offered to make another bowl but the line was 10 deep and we could not wait. Another bowl was undercooked. The staff appears to be about the lowest quality of people that they can possibly hire. Rude and unhelpful. If you go here good luck, I hope you have a better experience than we did.

SkEuewx1QMqVUQl6C1QeRQ.text: I'm Done with this place. Our visits were becoming longer and longer between each, due to the decline in the entire dining experience. We visited most recently on Saturday, July 13. It took 30 minutes to get seated and only slightly more than half the tables were occupied. Another 10-15 minutes to get our order taken (drinks and bowl size). Then we got to the bar where you fill your bowl. It was absolutely DISGUSTING. Food was cross-contaminated - spilled all over the counter. The sauces were spilled all over and about a third of them were empty. I really wanted to leave right then, but we stayed anyway. Our food was (thankfully) fully cooked, and it tasted good (of course, we chose all our own ingredients, so it SHOULD). But my wife and I decided we will NEVER return to this restaurant chain. It's so simple - keep the food at the bar fresh, and tidy and the customers do the rest, mostly. They can't even do that! Sad! Oh! And the entire experience took 2.5 hours from the time we walked in to the time we left. Service was so SLOOOOOW!!!

QJygYB-eXx5ULdaAF6yASQ.text: Oh my.  This place is sticky everywhere.  My wife reports that there was no soap in the women's rest room (employees not washing their hands?)  We were seated quickly and got our drinks.  The waiter was friendly and personable.  We went through the line, assembling our bowls and handed them off to the cook table.  About 25 minutes later, one of out 2 bowls comes to the table.  I think that it was mine... it had the rice I requested and something that might have been the beef I put in the bottom of my bowl before it was turned to charcoal.  Really.... it was black!  There wasn't even a hint of a vegetable (2/3 of what I handed over).  We flagged down the server and were questioning what happened when what we assumed was my wife's dish came to the table.  It had the pasta she requested, topped by what I could best describe as burnt dog kibble dropped at the table.  I saw the all vegetable / fruit items that she chose and I can't figure out how they took that input and created whatever was delivered to our table.  What is even more amazing was that someone scraped this off of the grill, put it on a starch and SERVED it!  No apology.  No "please reassemble a bowl and we will make it right."  They sent it to the table and looked surprised that we weren't thrilled!

VXzfViqa1jlvh-kfFZnRdw.text: Quan was GREAT !! Love the food !!! My first time here !!! I was a little confused i thought it was a buffet lol !! But i love it here ! Will definitely be back !!

obHlcy4Jj2ZwrJYOkRyZEA.text: The food is really good and fresh! The line wasn't long at all when I went and the service was nice. I like that you can pick out your meat, vegetables, and sauce! It's a great place to go if your a picky eater. Especially because you can pick everything that goes into your bowl.

NXkjTzmbv_sOMHT1BZRYCA.text: The food took over 20 minutes to cook and when it arrived it was burnt. This location has gone down hill. Used to be good but wouldn't recommend.

fHx6uMmitvh6e9aCfmH5AQ.text: I visited this restaurant with some friends years ago, and I remember enjoying it immensely.  However, since I live nearly 45 minutes away from this restaurant, I almost forgot about it altogether.  Only because of some errands scheduled on that part of town (Independence Boulevard), I decided to give Genghis another try.  As before, I enjoyed the near-novelty aspect of "Build Your Bowl" Stir Fry format...with the freedom to choose exactly the meat/meats, veggies and sauces that you wanted.  Also, the food was quickly prepared, once we handed over our bowls to the seemingly amateur team of T-shirt clad chefs (?) circling the grill.  As fun and/or interesting as it may be...of building your bowl by going through the line, handing over the bowl to the grill-side chefs, then heading back to the table to wait, it all felt a bit too casual and unsanitary.  It also felt a bit too hectic...and not very relaxing in terms of dining.  That aside, the stir-fried bowls were delivered to our table quickly, piping hot...and overall, quite satisfying!  In this particular occasion, however, I added too many varieties of sauce to my bowl, so the spiciness was a bit over the top.  Since I designed this meal myself, I've got nobody else to blame!  No matter, I did enjoy the entire experience...and will most definitely do it again.  Although the location was an issue, I discovered that there is now a Genghis Grill branch closer to me (Ballantyne location)...so that's where I'll be heading next.  Given that branch is newer, it may feel a bit more sanitary?

photos.caption: Photo of Genghis Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. &#34;Build Your Bowl&#34; Stir Fry

uGrDI7zWdX3cXB9D-uDwkw.text: I really wanted to love this place. I really enjoy the food but the service is just terrible. I ordered online and my order was a disaster. They couldn't get it right; they remade it and it was horrible. The manager insisted that the order was right but when I got it home it was wrong. The manager said they'd  refund the money but I never got the refund. My son loves it here and his birthday was yesterday so we went back. That is honestly the very last time I'll ever go to this location - the people cooking just stand around and the waiters/waitresses are so inexperienced. Couldn't even get the apps to come out before the dinner and there was a good 10-15 min between bowls being delivered. When we left the manager Manny was outside smoking and laughing with a few other workers. Stay away from this location - it's just not worth the frustration that you experience, not to mention the lies they tell you.

5t9xQOBzFfhhr6dQY9Kc8Q.text: The food is good, but honestly the service is horrible. The cooks stand around talking and not even working. We waited 35+minutes for our food, and my drink was refilled maybe one time the while time I was there. Would not recommend or the Ballantyne location with an hour wait

3RxZupBV_gQ-AgjCk0pEaQ.text: Went there first time Friday. I like to be served at a restaurant but this way I was able to put what I wanted into my meal. The wait staff are terrific here. I will definitely  be back here !!!!!!

jZFHgwkgMGDKko1vx6Kcmg.text: Slop in a bright orange bowl.  If you are craving Chinese food, skip this place.

Scar3-hdExYJs-v4WclDnQ.text: My daughter and I visited for dinner for the first time. This is more of a lunch place than dinner.   The wait staff was very helpful.  But I have to say that I was not impressed with the food and the music was way too loud for my taste.  I thought the meal was a little too pricey for what you get.  I suggest adding more spice than you think you need.  I thought I added enough.  But, my food came out bland. I am not a fan of americanized Asian food. Definitely prefer authentic.

QRlc5xI23RJv6pIrBQw9Ow.text: The reviews for Genghis are all over the map; not surprising since the place is so out of the ordinary.  No need to go through the descriptions as you will find them in other reviews. All I can say is we really like the place. Just be careful not to over-spice your bowl.

9u2dlfBlRzFODjBeE4YPvg.text: If you're a person who likes to be creative about what they eat. Then this is the place to go. If you have no imagination then pass on by. I love the idea of putting what I want in my food and making it taste how I want it to. It's all fresh and a lot  of it. I just wish the prep bowls were a little bigger. For ten dollars per person it's a little challenging to put it all in these bowls. Otherwise good food.
